intro: Hesperastragalus dispermus, commonly known as the two-seeded milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces two seeds per pod, as indicated by its specific epithet. Hesperastragalus dispermus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators in its native environment.
